metadata.Title: CVE-2023-42755 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - high
metadata.Description: A flaw was found in the IPv4 Resource Reservation Protocol (RSVP)classifier in the Linux kernel. The xprt pointer may go beyond the linearpart of the skb, leading to an out-of-bounds read in the `rsvp_classify`function. This issue may allow a local user to crash the system and cause adenial of service.

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
